metadata.label: Service & Consulting Companies
metadata.description: Project-based companies working with external clients

learningPathTweaks.title: Learning Path Optimized for Service Company Success
learningPathTweaks.subtitle: What you need to succeed at service and consulting firms

phaseAdaptations.note: Service companies need practical coding skills faster - focus on readability and teamwork
Delivery and client satisfaction are key - focus on pragmatic solutions
Service companies value engineers who can lead projects and understand business

areas.description: Can you write maintainable, readable code?
areas.emphasis: Code quality, testing, following best practices
Pragmatic approach, working solutions, not theoretical perfection

areas.description: Can you work with clients and teams?
areas.emphasis: Clarity, explaining technical concepts to non-technical people

areas.description: Can you work with different technologies?
areas.emphasis: Quick learning, flexibility, not being dogmatic

areas.description: Can you own a complete project?
areas.emphasis: From requirements to deployment, taking responsibility

roleExpectations.title: What You'll Do at a Service Company
responsibilities: Own complete client projects from requirement gathering to delivery
Work with clients to understand their needs
Write code that other developers can maintain and extend
Train or transition code to client teams
Collaborate with other team members on projects

reasoning: Service companies value practical skills and project ownership
Good learning opportunities across different projects and clients
Clear skill progression from junior to senior roles
whatYouNeed: Ability to communicate with non-technical people
Willingness to learn new technologies for different projects
growthOpportunities: Practice lead or domain expert roles

rounds.name: Project Discussion
rounds.description: Deep dive into a project you built

timelineAdjustment.explanation: Service company interviews are typically faster and more practical

estimatedTimeToHire.explanation: From current level to being job-ready for a service company role

commonChallengesAndTips.tip: Learn to focus on fundamentals that transfer across languages
Practice explaining technical concepts simply - this is a valuable skill
Learn estimation and time management - deliver on promises
Write code for the next person, not for the compiler - documentation matters
See this as an advantage - you'll learn more in 2 years than many do in 5

advantageOfServiceCareers: Exposure to many different projects and technologies
Learn how to ship products and deliver value
